meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Here's my take on Rogue Legacy 2. *takes deep breath* I'm gonna try not to gush too much (but let's be real, this game is amazing).

First off, kudos to the developers for not resting on their laurels and delivering a sequel that improves upon an already fantastic formula. The addition of new classes, biomes, and House Rules gives players a ton of options to tailor the experience to their liking - even if that means sacrificing your family tree (spoiler alert: it's worth it).

Now, I know some of my fellow critics are gonna be all like, "Oh, it's just another roguelite" (cough, IGN, cough). But let me tell you, Rogue Legacy 2 is more than just a bunch of procedurally generated levels and enemies. It's an experience that'll keep you coming back for more, even when the inevitable deaths happen.

And don't even get me started on the combat - it's like butter (the good kind, not the "I'm-trying-to-make-a-spread-but-it's-still-tedious" kind). Every enemy encounter feels deliberate and challenging, yet rewarding when you emerge victorious. I mean, who doesn't love a good "one more run" effect?

Now, if I'm being totally honest (and I am), some of the critics out there might not be as... enthusiastic about this game. Like Game Informer - they mentioned some "nitpicks," and I'm guessing that means something like "the progression systems could be a bit better" or "the ramp to endgame is kinda wonky." But honestly, those are just minor quibbles in an otherwise fantastic package.

All right, all right, I'll stop gushing now. Suffice it to say, Rogue Legacy 2 is a must-play for any fan of the genre (or anyone looking for a great game, period). Even the most discerning critics out there - like Destructoid - can't help but give it high praise.

So go ahead, grab your controller, and get ready to sacrifice your family tree (just kidding... or am I?). Hippo Penny says Rogue Legacy 2 is a real treasure.
